results.title: Comparing two means
results.creator_credit: David Huntley, Stephen Braun, Chedd-Angier Productions, American Statistical Association and COMAP
results.brief_description:
Episode number 22 of Series “Against all odds: inside statistics”.
Teresa M. Amabile looks at how to analyse two-sample problems, using a t procedure, to calculate the confidence interval for the difference between two means and a significance test to see whether two populations have two different means. Examples used are a comparison of two job training schemes for welfare recipients, testing the properties of a new foam product against the former one, and the efficacy of coaching for aptitude tests.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Huntley, Stephen Braun, Chedd-Angier Productions, American Statistical Association and COMAP

results.title: Significance tests
results.creator_credit: Jill Singer, David Huntley, Peggy Girshman, COMAP and Chedd-Angier Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “Against all odds: inside statistics”.
Describes the basic reasoning behind tests of significance. The concept if a null hypothesis is explained, and it is shown how a z-test is carried out when the hypothesis concerns the mean of a normal population with known standard deviation. Hosted by Teresa Amabile.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Singer, David Huntley, Peggy Girshman, COMAP and Chedd-Angier Productions

results.title: Experimental design
results.creator_credit: Jill Singer, Peggy Girshman, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Against all odds: inside statistics”.
Theresa M. Amabile introduces this first program on the design and conduct of experiments. She discusses the distinction between observational studies and experiments, the concept of control groups to reduce the risk of confounding results and randomized comparative experiments. Examples used are studies of lobsters and how they communicate, the use of aspirin in reducing the incidence of heart attacks and how the police should deal with cases of domestic violence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Singer, Peggy Girshman, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP

Examples used are studies of lobsters and how they communicate, the use of aspirin in reducing the incidence of heart attacks and how the police should deal with cases of domestic violence.

results.title: The Colonel
results.creator_credit: Jenifer Hooks, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An army colonel, having outlived his usefulness to the revolution, is imprisoned. Refusing to sign a false confession, he is eventually forced into a position of choice - his principles or his life.

results.title: Morris loves Jack
results.brief_description:
Morris loves Jack - or does he?
Jack is a young, dedicated policewoman who lives with Morris, a charming but lazy layabout. But he has become a habit she can’t break and so she puts up with the frustrations and disappointments of living with him - until one night the police are called to a noisy party…Cast includes Kris McQuade, John Hargreaves, Bill Hunter and David Boyd.

group_siblings.title: Distinguished guests
group_siblings.creator_credit: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS

results.title: Distinguished guests
results.creator_credit: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Christopher (Colin Friels) is sure he really likes psychology - but not the way it is taught at his university. Professor Wiseman, his tutor, is a disciple of the eminent European pyschologist, Professor Eisenbach - a cold rational behaviourist whose books are always cited as authorities. As a joke, Christopher and his girlfriend decide that he will impersonate Eisenbach and teach Professor Wiseman a lesson. Co-written by PJ Hogan (Muriel’s Wedding). Also features Tracy Mann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS
